1.text: He that being often reproved hardeneth his neck Shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy

2.text: When the righteous are increased, the people rejoice; But when a wicked man beareth rule, the people sigh.

3.text: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father; But he that keepeth company with harlots wasteth his substance.

4.text: The king by justice establisheth the land; But he that exacteth gifts overthroweth it.

5.text: A man that flattereth his neighbor Spreadeth a net for his steps.

6.text: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare; But the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

7.text: The righteous taketh knowledge of the cause of the poor; The wicked hath not understanding to know it.

8.text: Scoffers set a city in a flame; But wise men turn away wrath.

9.text: If a wise man hath a controversy with a foolish man, Whether he be angry or laugh, there will be no rest.

10.text: The bloodthirsty hate him that is perfect; And as for the upright, they seek his life.

11.text: A fool uttereth all his anger; But a wise man keepeth it back and stilleth it.

12.text: If a ruler hearkeneth to falsehood, All his servants are wicked.

13.text: The poor man and the oppressor meet together; Jehovah lighteneth the eyes of them both.

14.text: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, His throne shall be established for ever.

15.text: The rod and reproof give wisdom; But a child left to himself causeth shame to his mother.

16.text: When the wicked are increased, transgression increaseth; But the righteous shall look upon their fall.

17.text: Correct thy son, and he will give thee rest; Yea, he will give delight unto thy soul.

18.text: Where there is no vision, the people cast off restraint; But he that keepeth the law, happy is he.

19.text: A servant will not be corrected by words; For though he understand, he will not give heed.

20.text: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? There is more hope of a fool than of him.

21.text: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child Shall have him become a son at the last.

22.text: An angry man stirreth up strife, And a wrathful man aboundeth in transgression.

23.text: A man’s pride shall bring him low; But he that is of a lowly spirit shall obtain honor.

24.text: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul; He heareth the adjuration and uttereth nothing.

25.text: The fear of man bringeth a snare; But whoso putteth his trust in Jehovah shall be safe.

26.text: Many seek the ruler’s favor; But a man’s judgment cometh from Jehovah.

27.text: An unjust man is an abomination to the righteous; And he that is upright in the way is an abomination to the wicked.
